chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
u: nat -> R
M: R

Goal:
(forall n : nat, u n <= u (S n)) -> (forall n : nat, u n <= M) -> ex_finite_lim_seq u

Premises:
ex_finite_lim_seq = fun u : nat -> R => exists l : R, is_lim_seq u l : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
ex_finite_lim_seq_decr : forall (u : nat -> R) (M : R), (forall n : nat, u (S n) <= u n) -> (forall n : nat, M <= u n) -> ex_finite_lim_seq u
ex_lim_seq_incr : forall u : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, u n <= u (S n)) -> ex_lim_seq u
is_lim_seq_incr_compare : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : R), is_lim_seq u l -> (forall n : nat, u n <= u (S n)) -> forall n : nat, u n <= l
is_lim_seq_decr_compare : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : R), is_lim_seq u l -> (forall n : nat, u (S n) <= u n) -> forall n : nat, l <= u n
ex_lim_seq_decr : forall u : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, u (S n) <= u n) -> ex_lim_seq u
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
is_LimSup_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall N : nat, exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ l0 - eps < u n) /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < l0 + eps) | p_infty => forall (M : R) (N : nat), exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ M < u n | m_infty => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < M end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
ex_lim_seq_cauchy = fun u : nat -> R => forall eps : posreal, exists N : nat, forall n m : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> (N <= m)%nat -> Rabs (u n - u m) < eps : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
Lim_seq_correct' : forall u : nat -> R, ex_finite_lim_seq u -> is_lim_seq u (Lim_seq u)
Alembert_C5 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
ex_lim_seq_cauchy_corr : forall u : nat -> R, ex_finite_lim_seq u < -> ex_lim_seq_cauchy u
le_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : nat -> Prop), P n -> (forall m : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> P m -> P (S m)) -> forall n0 : nat, (n <= n0)%nat -> P n0
Alembert_C4 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
ex_finite_lim_seq_correct : forall u : nat -> R, ex_finite_lim_seq u < -> ex_lim_seq u /\ is_finite (Lim_seq u)
tech1 : forall (An : nat -> R) (N : nat), (forall n : nat, (n <= N)%nat -> 0 < An n) -> 0 < sum_f_R0 An N
Un_growing = fun Un : nat -> R => forall n : nat, Un n <= Un (S n) : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
is_lim_seq' = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, eventually (fun n : nat => Rabs (u n - l0) < eps) | p_infty => forall M : R, eventually (fun n : nat => M < u n) | m_infty => forall M : R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n < M) end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
tech13 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> exists k0 : R, k < k0 < 1 /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> Rabs (An (S n) / An n) < k0)
Lim_seq_correct : forall u : nat -> R, ex_lim_seq u -> is_lim_seq u (Lim_seq u)
ex_finite_lim_seq_dec : forall u : nat -> R, {ex_finite_lim_seq u} + {~ ex_finite_lim_seq u}
ex_lim_seq = fun u : nat -> R => exists l : Rbar, is_lim_seq u l : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
gt_S_le : forall n m : nat, (S m > n)%nat -> (n <= m)%nat
eventually = fun P : nat -> Prop => exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> P n : (nat -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
tech4 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R) (N : nat), 0 <= k -> (forall i : nat, An (S i) < k * An i) -> An N <= An 0%nat * k ^ N
is_lim_seq_unique : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l -> Lim_seq u = l
ex_inf_seq : forall u : nat -> Rbar, {l : Rbar | is_inf_seq u l}
ex_sup_seq : forall u : nat -> Rbar, {l : Rbar | is_sup_seq u l}
ex_LimSup_seq : forall u : nat -> R, {l : Rbar | is_LimSup_seq u l}
INR_le : forall n m : nat, INR n <= INR m -> (n <= m)%nat
inj_le : forall n m : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> (Z.of_nat n <= Z.of_nat m)%Z
le_INR : forall n m : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> INR n <= INR m
le_n_0_eq : forall n : nat, (n <= 0)%nat -> 0%nat = n
lt = fun n m : nat => (S n <= m)%nat : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
tech6 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R) (N : nat), 0 <= k -> (forall i : nat, An (S i) < k * An i) -> sum_f_R0 An N <= An 0%nat * sum_f_R0 (fun i : nat => k ^ i) N
is_lim_seq_spec : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq' u l < -> is_lim_seq u l
is_inf_seq = fun (u : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall n : nat, Rbar_lt (l0 - eps) (u n)) /\ (exists n : nat, Rbar_lt (u n) (l0 + eps)) | p_infty => forall (M : R) (n : nat), Rbar_lt M (u n) | m_infty => forall M : R, exists n : nat, Rbar_lt (u n) M end : (nat -> Rbar) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_sup_seq = fun (u : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall n : nat, Rbar_lt (u n) (l0 + eps)) /\ (exists n : nat, Rbar_lt (l0 - eps) (u n)) | p_infty => forall M : R, exists n : nat, Rbar_lt M (u n) | m_infty => forall (M : R) (n : nat), Rbar_lt (u n) M end : (nat -> Rbar) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
LimSup_seq = fun u : nat -> R => proj1_sig (ex_LimSup_seq u) : (nat -> R) -> Rbar Argument scope is [function_scope]
Nat.nle_succ_0 : forall n : nat, ~ (S n <= 0)%nat
lt_n_S : forall n m : nat, (n < m)%nat -> (S n < S m)%nat

```coq
intros u M H1 H2.
apply ex_finite_lim_seq_decr with M.
- intro n. specialize (H1 n). specialize (H2 n).
  transitivity (u (S n)); auto.
- intro n. specialize (H2 n). apply H2.
Qed.
```

original: intros u M H1 H2. apply ex_finite_lim_seq_decr with M. - intro n. specialize (H1 n). specialize (H2 n). transitivity (u (S n)); auto. - intro n. specialize (H2 n). apply H2.
